definition: to give up/to abandon/to give alms

sentences.english: One big difference is man's attitude toward the seperation of sex and love.
sentences.chinese: 其中一個取捨的結果，就是性與愛的分離。

sentences.english: In this critical time of a toss-up, she will be where to go?
sentences.chinese: 在這難以取捨的關鍵時刻，她將何去何從？

sentences.english: TV fans may have tough choicesin new season.
sentences.chinese: 新劇季到來，電視迷們可能要難做取捨了。

sentences.english: How do we calculate these kind of trade-offs?
sentences.chinese: 我們怎麼來計算這樣的取捨呢？

sentences.english: How should we choose between these two views?
sentences.chinese: 我們該如何在兩個理論之間取捨？

sentences.english: The fourth problem is whether to keep elimination regulation.
sentences.chinese: 第四個問題是滌除權制度取捨。

sentences.english: I feel like I have to choose between my personal life and my career.
sentences.chinese: 我感覺自己必須在個人生活和事業之間做出取捨。

sentences.english: And I-I can't decide between the two of them.
sentences.chinese: 而我無法在這兩個女孩中取捨。

sentences.english: It depends on what your views are about freedom versus societal level benefits.
sentences.chinese: 這取決於你如何看待自由和社會層面利益之間的取捨。

sentences.english: Really, how can you pick one Bront? over the other?
sentences.chinese: 說實在的，你怎麼能在兩個勃朗特間作取捨呢？

sentences.english: As a reader, you face trade-offs with both.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一個讀者，你得做出取捨。

sentences.english: No trade-off between increases in living standards and population size.
sentences.chinese: 不再需要在生活水準與人口之間取捨。

sentences.english: These would be perfectly valid reasons to choose one software platform over another.
sentences.chinese: 對於取捨一個軟件平臺這可能是完全有效的理由。

sentences.english: Take the trade-off between price and quality.
sentences.chinese: 以價格和品質間的取捨爲例。

sentences.english: and I don't know, it's a trade off.
sentences.chinese: 我也不知道，這是種取捨。

sentences.english: And the terms of this trade-off depend on underlying conditions.
sentences.chinese: 取捨交易取決於基本條件。

definition: to consider/to weigh (a matter)/to balance (pros and cons)
pragmatic/flexible/to act differently in different situations/to accommodate to circumstances
to satisfy both sides/to accommodate both (demands)
severity (of the case)/degree of seriousness/whether sth is slight or serious
to ask oneself/to search one's soul/to reach a conclusion after weighing a matter
to remove/to step back from involvement/to disengage
